name: Jitter · Animate your Figma designs
description:
Jitter lets you animate your designs from Figma in just a few clicks, and export the animation as a video or as a GIF.


What is Jitter?

Jitter is an easy-to-use animation tool on the web. It's like Figma, but for motion design: we help designers make animations for videos, websites or apps in a simple way, while building their motion design system. It's fast and easy, and you can export your creations as HD videos (60 fps) or GIFs.


How to use the plugin

  1. Open the plugin
  2. Select a frame, and click the “Export” button
  3. Open the project in Jitter and create some magic! ✨


FAQ

How are you different from other plugins?

We use a unique way to make animations: After Effects and most animations plugins (Motion, Figmotion, Aninix, SVG Motion, Bannerify and the other Figmatic plugins…) use the traditional keyframe system. Instead, we use an animation model where we give instructions to the layers (like “Slide in”, “Fade out”…): building an animation is more intuitive – in fact, it is as easy as building an animation in PowerPoint or Keynote, but you have total control over the parameters.


What kind of animations can I do with Jitter?

Whether you are designing an app, a website, an illustration, a presentation video, a social media post, an Instagram Story, a YouTube intro, or anything else, you can import your design into Jitter in 1 click and animate right away.


Can I animate text?

Yes, text animation is actually our specialty: you can put a text in motion with an animation preset, and then customize several parameters like speed, duration, easing – and more importantly, you can choose if you want to animate letter by letter, word by word, or line by line.


Can I design micro-interactions?

Yes, you can animate all the basic properties of your layers and masks (position, size, rotation, scale, opacity, corner radius, shadow…).


How do I handoff the animation to the developers?

You can share the project URL, so that your developers can inspect the animation parameters. We know this is a common use case, so we plan to develop the animation inspector further for easy handoff, and to build your own motion design system.


Does it support all features from Figma?

Our priority is to make a pixel-perfect import. We support all the major properties from Figma natively. For layers that are too complex to be supported natively in Jitter, we convert the layer to an image, so that you get exactly the same thing as in Figma.

Here are the current limitations:

  • Rich texts (multiple colors or font weight in the same text layer) are exported as images
  • Elements with gradient fills, multiple fills, strokes, multiple shadows or effects are exported as images
  • Only simple masks are supported in Jitter (when the masking layer is the last layer of the group) – in all other cases, mask groups are exported as images
  • Blend modes are not supported in Jitter


Can I import multiple artboards?

At the moment, you can only import one artboard at a time. We will add support for multiple artboards in the near future.


I found a bug, what should I do?

We're still in beta: if you encounter any bugs, please reach out to us and we'll be able to fix it rapidly :) You can contact us at figma.plugin@jitter.video, or on our website https://jitter.video.
